name: 4 Apart
desc: If the difference between your fates is 4 or more, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: After playing their fate, the active player may discard one visible fate that is lower than their remaining face.

name: Match
desc: If one of your fates matches a visible fate, play your other fate here.
fadeDesc: Before playing their fate, the active player may replace an empty arcana card with the top card of the deck.

name: Higher
desc: If one of your fates is higher than the other, play the higher one here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may pick a number X and ask, "Is your fate higher than X?"

name: Unique
desc: If both of your fates are unique from each other and all visible fates, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: Before playing their fate, the active player may replace an empty arcana card with the top card of the deck.

name: Same
desc: If both of your fates are the same, play one of them here
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may choose to make one extra prediction this turn.

desc: If one of your fates is exactly 2 more or less than the other, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may choose to make one extra prediction this turn.

name: Even
desc: If the sum of your fates is even, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 3, 4, or 5?"

desc: If one of your fates is 5, 6, or 7, and the other is not, play the 5, 6, or 7 here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 5, 6, or 7?"

name: Free
desc: Play one of your fates here. Does not further your doom when fading.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 1, 4, or 7?"

desc: If the sum of your fates is 11 or more, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: After playing their fate, the active player may discard one visible fate that is lower than their remaining face.

name: 7 to 9
desc: If the sum of your fates is 7, 8, or 9, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: After playing their fate, the active player may say whether they had that fate during their previous turn.

name: Odd
desc: If the sum of your fates is odd, play one of them here
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 1, 2, or 3?"

desc: If the sum of your fates is a multiple of 3, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: After playing their fate, the active player may discard one visible fate that is lower than their remaining face.

desc: If one of your fates is exactly 1 more or less than the other, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may choose to make one extra prediction this turn.

desc: If one of your fates is 3, 4, or 5, and the other is not, play the 3, 4, or 5 here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 3, 4, or 5?"

name: Factor
desc: If one of your fates is double or triple the other, play one of them here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 5, 6, or 7?"

desc: If one of your fates is 1, 2, or 3, and the other is not, play the 1, 2, or 3 here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 1, 2, or 3?"

name: Tell
desc: Play one of your fates here. If you do, say whether your remaining fate is higher than the one you played.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may ask, "Is your fate 1, 4, or 7?"

name: Lower
desc: If one of your fates is lower than the other, play the lower one here.
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may pick a number X and ask,"Is your fate higher than X?"

desc: If the sum of your fates is 5 or less, play one of them here
fadeDesc: Before making a prediction, the group may pick a number X and ask,"Is your fate higher than X?"
